intro: Pedicularis oederi var. bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa lousewort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species that derive some of their nutrients from host plants. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, with a distinctive hooded shape. It thrives in alpine and subalpine habitats, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in botanical gardens and among enthusiasts of alpine flora.
